pymt.mtpyglet¶

Soup on pyglet to provide multitouch interface.

class pymt.mtpyglet.Tuio2DCursor(blobID, args, time_start=0)¶
Represent a Tuio cursor + implementation of double-tap functionnality
class pymt.mtpyglet.Tuio2DObject(blobID, args)¶
Represent a Tuio object
class pymt.mtpyglet.TouchEventLoop(host='127.0.0.1', port=3333)¶
Main event loop. This loop dispatch Tuio message and pyglet event.
class pymt.mtpyglet.TouchWindow(**kwargs)¶

Base implementation of Tuio event in top of pyglet window.

Events:
on_touch_down

Fired when a blob is detected

on_touch_move

Fired when the blob is moving

on_touch_up

Fired when the blob is gone

on_object_down

Fired when the object is detected

on_object_move

Fired when the object is moving

on_object_up

Fired when the object is gone
pymt.mtpyglet.pymt_usage()¶

PyMT Usage: %s [OPTION...] -h, –help prints this mesage -f, –fullscreen force run in fullscreen -w, –windowed force run in window -p, –port=x specify Tuio port (default 3333) -H, –host=xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx specify Tuio host (default 127.0.0.1) -F, –fps show fps in window

--dump-frame dump each frame in file
--dump-prefix specify a prefix for each frame file
--dump-format specify a format for dump
pymt.mtpyglet.runTouchApp()¶
Static main function that starts the application loop
pymt.mtpyglet.startTuio()¶
Start Tuio listening
pymt.mtpyglet.stopTuio()¶
Stop Tuio listening
